column3: What documents are required to apply for a passport?
column4: You need a completed application form, national ID or birth certificate, recent passport-size photos, and proof of payment. (DEMO)

column3: Where can I apply for a passport?
column4: You can apply at the main immigration office or designated regional passport offices. (DEMO)

column3: How much does a passport cost?
column4: The passport fee depends on the type and processing speed. Please check the official fee schedule. (DEMO)

column3: How long does it take to get a passport?
column4: Normal processing takes several weeks, while expedited services are faster. (DEMO)

column3: Can I apply for a passport online?
column4: Some steps may be completed online, but physical presence is required for biometrics. (DEMO)

column3: What is the validity period of a passport?
column4: Passports are usually valid for 5 or 10 years depending on applicant category. (DEMO)

column3: How do I renew an expired passport?
column4: You must submit the old passport, renewal form, photos, and pay the renewal fee. (DEMO)

column3: Can I renew my passport before it expires?
column4: Yes, early renewal is allowed within a specified period before expiry. (DEMO)

column3: What should I do if my passport is lost?
column4: Report the loss immediately and apply for a replacement with a police report. (DEMO)

column3: What should I do if my passport is damaged?
column4: Submit the damaged passport with an explanation letter and apply for replacement. (DEMO)

column3: Can children apply for passports?
column4: Yes, minors can apply with parental consent and guardian documents. (DEMO)

column3: What documents are required for a child passport?
column4: Birth certificate, parent IDs, consent letter, and photos are required. (DEMO)

column3: Do both parents need to be present for a child passport?
column4: Usually yes, unless legal documents state otherwise. (DEMO)

column3: Can a guardian apply on behalf of a minor?
column4: Yes, with valid guardianship documents. (DEMO)

column3: What is biometric enrollment?
column4: It includes capturing fingerprints, photo, and signature at the passport office. (DEMO)

column3: Is biometric data mandatory?
column4: Yes, biometric data is required for passport issuance. (DEMO)

column3: Can elderly applicants skip biometrics?
column4: Certain exemptions may apply based on age or health conditions. (DEMO)

column3: What type of photos are required for passport application?
column4: Recent passport-size photos with a white background are required. (DEMO)

column3: Can I smile in my passport photo?
column4: No, a neutral facial expression is required. (DEMO)

column3: What happens if my application is rejected?
column4: You will be informed of the reason and advised on corrective steps. (DEMO)

column3: Can I track my passport application status?
column4: Yes, you can track status using the reference number provided. (DEMO)

column3: What is an expedited passport service?
column4: It is a faster processing option available for additional fees. (DEMO)

column3: Who is eligible for expedited passport processing?
column4: Applicants with urgent travel needs may qualify. (DEMO)

column3: Can I change my name on my passport?
column4: Yes, with legal proof such as a court order or marriage certificate. (DEMO)

column3: How do I correct errors on my passport?
column4: Apply for correction with supporting documents showing the error. (DEMO)

column3: Is passport replacement free if the error is not mine?
column4: Corrections due to official error may be free of charge. (DEMO)

column3: Can I travel if my passport is about to expire?
column4: Most countries require at least six months validity. (DEMO)

column3: What should I do if my passport expires abroad?
column4: Contact the nearest embassy or consulate for assistance. (DEMO)

column3: Can I hold two passports?
column4: Dual passports are only allowed under specific legal conditions. (DEMO)

column3: What is a machine-readable passport?
column4: It is a passport with encoded data readable by scanners. (DEMO)

column3: What is an e-passport?
column4: An electronic passport contains a biometric chip for security. (DEMO)

column3: Is an e-passport mandatory?
column4: E-passports are becoming standard but availability may vary. (DEMO)

column3: Can I apply for a passport while abroad?
column4: Yes, through embassies or consulates. (DEMO)

column3: How long does overseas passport processing take?
column4: It may take longer than domestic processing. (DEMO)

column3: What payment methods are accepted for passport fees?
column4: Payments can be made via bank deposit or approved payment channels. (DEMO)

column3: Is the passport fee refundable?
column4: Passport fees are generally non-refundable. (DEMO)

column3: What is a temporary travel document?
column4: It is issued for emergency travel when a passport is unavailable. (DEMO)

column3: Who can get a temporary travel document?
column4: Citizens with urgent travel needs may qualify. (DEMO)

column3: Can I update my address on my passport?
column4: Address updates usually do not require passport reissue. (DEMO)

column3: Does passport issuance require an appointment?
column4: Appointments may be required depending on office capacity. (DEMO)

column3: How do I book a passport appointment?
column4: Appointments can be booked online or at the service office. (DEMO)

column3: What should I bring on my appointment day?
column4: Original documents, copies, photos, and payment receipt. (DEMO)

column3: Can someone else collect my passport for me?
column4: Collection by proxy may be allowed with authorization. (DEMO)

column3: How will I be notified when my passport is ready?
column4: You may receive SMS or email notification. (DEMO)

column3: What if I miss my passport appointment?
column4: You may need to reschedule or rebook a new appointment. (DEMO)

column3: Can pregnant women get priority service?
column4: Priority may be given based on medical need. (DEMO)

column3: Are persons with disabilities given special support?
column4: Yes, assistance and priority service may be provided. (DEMO)

column3: What languages are supported in passport services?
column4: Services are usually provided in major national languages. (DEMO)

column3: Can refugees apply for national passports?
column4: Refugees must follow specific legal procedures. (DEMO)

column3: What is a diplomatic passport?
column4: It is issued to government officials for official travel. (DEMO)

column3: What is a service passport?
column4: It is issued for official government duties abroad. (DEMO)

column3: Who qualifies for a diplomatic passport?
column4: High-level officials and diplomats qualify. (DEMO)

column3: Can ordinary citizens apply for diplomatic passports?
column4: No, eligibility is restricted by law. (DEMO)

column3: How many blank pages should a passport have?
column4: At least two blank pages are recommended for travel. (DEMO)

column3: Can I add extra pages to my passport?
column4: Extra pages are not added; renewal is required. (DEMO)

column3: What happens to my old passport after renewal?
column4: It may be returned with cancellation marks. (DEMO)

column3: Can I keep my old passport after renewal?
column4: Yes, but it will be invalid for travel. (DEMO)

column3: What is the passport application reference number?
column4: It is a unique number used to track your application. (DEMO)

column3: Is fingerprint data stored securely?
column4: Yes, biometric data is stored under strict security rules. (DEMO)

column3: Can my passport be revoked?
column4: Yes, under certain legal circumstances. (DEMO)

column3: What laws govern passport issuance?
column4: Passport services are governed by national immigration laws. (DEMO)

column3: Where can I get official passport information?
column4: From the official immigration authority website or offices. (DEMO)

column3: Who should I contact for passport complaints?
column4: Contact the customer service desk or complaint office. (DEMO)

column3: Can I apply for a passport with an expired ID?
column4: Valid identification is required for application. (DEMO)

column3: Is an interview required for passport application?
column4: Some applicants may be required to attend an interview. (DEMO)

column3: What security checks are done before issuing a passport?
column4: Identity verification and background checks are performed. (DEMO)

column3: Can I update my marital status on my passport?
column4: Marital status changes require legal proof. (DEMO)

column3: What should I do if my passport is stolen abroad?
column4: Report to local police and contact your embassy immediately. (DEMO)

column3: Can I apply for a passport if I owe legal fines?
column4: Outstanding legal issues may affect eligibility. (DEMO)

column3: How early should I apply before traveling?
column4: Apply several months before your planned travel date. (DEMO)
